data.text:
Hometown Health is a statewide not-for-profit health insurance company that began operation in 1988. We recently expanded our presence to Southern Nevada to provide residents with the same high-quality care Hometown Health is known for in Northern Nevada. Our company believes in a health insurance system that values engaging relationships between members and their physicians. Hometown Health offers one of the largest provider networks in the region, with more than 6,000 providers across the state. We work to put the patient in the center of the healthcare system – investing substantially in research, health professional education, subsidized health services, and community health improvement. Our mission is to “make a genuine difference in the health and well-being of the people and communities we serve.” Our values are “Collaboration, Caring, Integrity, and Excellence,” which hold true when it comes to both our members and employees. As a Wellness company, Hometown Health is focused on making sure our members are taken care of when it comes to their health through programs, such as Healthy Tracks and Motivate U, an intense 12-week boot camp style workout program that’s free for members. At Hometown Health, we focus on the five dimensions: physical health, intellectual, spiritual, social and emotional. We also participate in a multitude of community involvement opportunities throughout the year, such as the Boys & Girls Club, Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF), and the Alzheimer’s Association. Hometown Health has more than 150,000 members that take advantage of our strong interest in their health and well-being. For more information about Hometown Health, individuals and businesses should contact their broker or visit https://www.hometownhealth.com.
